meanings.sent1: The teacher used flashcards to reinforce the students' understanding of the math concept.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers used steel beams to reinforce the building's structure.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's cape seemed to reinforce his invincibility in the eyes of the villains.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a warm hug, reinforcing the sense of belonging in the group.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the waves crashing against the shore reinforced the peaceful atmosphere of the beach.

meanings.definition: To make stronger or more effective
meanings.sent1: Eating healthy food can reinforce your immune system and help you stay well.
meanings.sent2: Regular practice can reinforce your skills and make you a better musician.
meanings.sent3: The magician's wand seemed to reinforce his ability to perform amazing tricks.
meanings.sent4: Her encouraging words were like a magic spell, reinforcing his confidence.
meanings.sent5: The bright colors of the painting reinforced the artist's message of hope and joy.

meanings.definition: To provide additional personnel or equipment for support
meanings.sent1: The army decided to reinforce the troops with more soldiers for the upcoming mission.
meanings.sent2: The company will reinforce the customer service team with extra staff during the busy season.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to reinforce the kitchen staff with an extra sous chef for the special event.
meanings.sent4: The coach reinforced the team with new equipment to improve their performance on the field.
meanings.sent5: The school reinforced the security team with additional guards to ensure safety during the event.
